Technique: HEWN; CARVED; RELIEF; ENGRAVED; PAINTED; STUCCO
Name: Stela of offerings to Amun by Ramesses III
Description: This limestone stela is composed of a large offering scene and a hieroglyphic inscription. The king Ramesses III, whose head is surmounted by a solar disk with two uraei, presents the traditional offering of two "nu" vases to the Theban god Amun. The texts, grouped at the top and the bottom of the stela, mention only the name of Amun and the name and several titles of Ramesses III. The stela was carved in the hollow, then stuccoed and ultimately painted.
